Manx: TRA ta’n dooinney mee-chrauee chyndaa ersooyl veih’n vee-chraueeaght t’eh er ny ve cur rish, as jannoo shen ta cairagh as jeeragh, sauee eh e annym bio. Ezek. xviii. 27.
English: WHEN the wicked man turneth away from his wickedness, that he hath committed, and doeth that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul alive.

Manx: Ta mee goaill rish m’ oiljyn, as ta my pheccah kinjagh kiongoyrt rhym. Psal. li. 3.
English: I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me.

Manx: Follee dty eddin veih my pheccaghyn, as leih dou ooilley my vee-chraueeaght. Psal. li. 9.
English: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out mine iniquities.

Manx: Ta ourallyn Yee spyrryd seaghnit; cree brisht as arryssagh, O Yee, cha soie uss beg jeh. Psal. li. 17.
English: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit : a broken and a contrite heart, O God, Thou wilt not despise.

Manx: Raip-jee nyn greeaghyn, as cha nee nyn goamraghyn, as chyndaa-jee gys y Chiarn y Jee eu : son t’eh graysoil as myghinagh, moal gys corree, as dy chenjallys vooar, as meigh-chreeagh tra t’eh kerraghey. Joel ii. 13.
English: Rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the Lord your God : for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth Him of the evil.

Manx: Gys y Chiarn y Jee ain ta bentyn myghinyn as leih peccaghyn, ga dy vel shin er n’irree magh n’oi : cha-moo ta shin er choyrt biallys da coraa yn Chiarn y Jee ain, dy immeeaght ayns e leighaghyn t’eh er hoiaghey roïn. Dan. ix. 9, 10.
English: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him : neither have we obeyed the voice of the Lord our God, to walk in his laws, which He set before us.

Manx: O Hiarn, smaghtee mee, agh lesh foayr; cha nee ayns dty chorree, er aggle dy der oo lhiat mee gys veg. Jer. x. 24. Psal. vi. 1.
English: O Lord, correct me, but with judgement; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

Manx: Gow-jee arrys; son ta reeriaght niau er-gerrey. Mat. iii. 2.
English: Repent ye; for the Kingdom of heaven is at hand.

Manx: Trog-ym’s orrym, as hem roym gys m’ ayr, as jir-ym rish, Ayr, ta mee er n’yannoo peccah noi niau, as kiongoyrt rhyts, as cha vel mee ny sodjey feeu dy ve enmyssit dty vac. Luke xv. 18, 19.
English: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him; Father, I have sinned against heaven, and before thee, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.

Manx: Ny gow er dty hoshiaght gys briwnys rish dty harvaant, O Hiarn; son ayns dty hilley’s cha bee dooinney erbee bio er ny heyrey. Psal. cxliii. 2.
English: Enter not into judgement with thy servant, O Lord; for in Thy sight shall no man living be justified.

Manx: My ta shin gra dy vel shin gyn peccah, ta shin molley shin hene, as cha vel yn irriney ain. Agh my ta shin goaill-rish nyn beccaghyn, t’eshyn firrinagh as cairagh dy leih dooin nyn beccaghyn, as dy ghlenney shin veih dy chooilley neu-ynrickys. 1 John i. 8, 9.
English: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us : But if we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

Manx: CHAARJYN ghraihagh, ta Goo Yee dy choyrlaghey shin ayns ymmodee ynnydyn dy hoilshaghey as dy ghoaill-rish nyn ymmodee filley peccaghyn as olkys, as nagh lhisagh shin ad y cheiltyn ny ’choodaghey kiongoyrt rish eddin Yee Ooilley-niartal nyn Ayr flaunyssagh, agh goaill roo lesh cree imlee, injil, arryssagh as ammyssagh, dy vod mayd leih y gheddyn er nyn son, liorish e vieys as e vyghin er-skyn-earroo. As ga dy lhisagh shin ec dy chooilley hraa dy-imlee goaill-rish nyn beccaghyn kiongoyrt rish Jee, foast lhisagh shin er-skyn ooilley shen y yannoo, tra ta shin chaglym as meeteil cooidjagh, dy choyrt booise son ny toyrtyssyn mooarey ta shin er gheddyn veih e laueyn, dy hoiaghey magh e voylley smoo feeu, dy eaishtagh rish e Ghoo smoo casherick, as dy yeearree ny reddyn shen ta fêmoil as ymmyrchagh, chammah son y chorp as yn annym. Shen-y-fa ta mee guee as geearree erriu, whilleen as t’ayns shoh kionfenish, dy yannoo sheshaght mâryms lesh cree glen, as coraa imlee, gys stoyl-reeoil yn ghrayse flaunyssagh, gra my yeih’s:
English: DEARLY beloved brethren, the Scripture moveth us in sundry places to acknowledge and confess our manifold sins and wickedness; and that we should not dissemble nor cloke them before the face of Almighty God our heavenly Father; but confess them with an humble, lowly, penitent, and obedient heart; to the end that we may obtain forgiveness of the same, by his infinite goodness and mercy. And although we ought at all times humbly to acknowledge our sins before God; yet ought we most chiefly so to do, when we assemble, and meet together, to render thanks for the great benefits that we have received at His hands, to set forth his most worthy praise, to hear his most holy Word, and to ask those things which are requisite and necessary, as well for the body as the soul. Wherefore I pray, and beseech you, as many as are here present, to accompany me with a pure heart, and humble voice, unto the throne of the heavenly grace, saying after me:

Manx: AYR Ooilley-niartal as smoo laane jeh dty vyghin; Ta shin er n’gholl er-shaghryn veih dty raaidyn casley rish kirree cailjey. Ta shin er eiyrt rouyr er smooinaghtyn as yeearreeyn ny creeaghyn ain hene. Ta shin er n’yannoo peccah noi dty leighaghyn casherick. Ta shin er n’aagail gyn jannoo ny reddyn shen lhisagh shin v’er n’yannoo; As ta shin er n’yannoo ny reddyn shen nagh lhisagh shin v’er n’yannoo; As cha vel slaynt erbee aynin. Agh uss, O Hiarn, jean myghin orrin peccee hreih. Ymmyrk uss lhieusyn, O Yee, ta goaill-rish nyn voiljyn. Gow uss adsyn reesht ta arryssagh; Cordail rish dty yialdinyn er ny hoilshaghey (sic) da sheelnaue ayns Creest Yeesey nyn Jiarn. As giall, O Ayr smoo laane jeh dty vyghin, er y ghraih echeysyn; Dy vod mayd ny yeih shoh beaghey dy-crauee, dy-cairal, as dy-sheelt, Gys gloyr dt’ Ennym’s casherick. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY and most merciful Father; We have erred, and strayed from thy ways like lost sheep; We have followed too much the devices and desires of our own hearts; We have offended against thy holy laws: We have left undone those things, which we ought to have done; And we have done those things which we ought not to have done; And there is no health in us. But thou, O Lord, have mercy upon us, miserable offenders; Spare thou them, O God, which confess their faults: Restore thou them that are penitent; According to thy promises declared unto mankind in Christ Jesu our Lord. And grant, O most merciful Father, for his sake, That we may hereafter live a godly, righteous, and sober life, To the glory of thy holy Name. Amen.

Manx: JEE Ooilley-niartal, Ayr nyn Jiarn Yeesey Creest, nagh vel shirrey baase peccagh, agh baare lesh eh dy hyndaa veih’n olkys echey, as ve bio; as ta er choyrt pooar as saarey da e Hirveishee dy hoilshaghey as d’ ockley magh da e phobble, ta arryssagh, pardoon as leih son nyn beccaghyn: T’eh pardooney as leih dauesyn ooilley ta dy-firrinagh goaill arrys, as dy-shickyr credjal e Hushtal casherick. Shen-y-fa lhig dooin guee ersyn dy choyrt dooin arrys firrinagh, as e Spyrryd Casherick, dy vod ny reddyn shen eshyn y wooiys ta shin jannoo ec y traa shoh, as dy vod y chooid elley jeh’n vea ain ny yeih shoh ve glen as crauee; myr shen ec y jerrey dy vod mayd cheet gys e voggey dy-bragh beayn, trooid YeeseAYR ain, t’ayns niau; Casherick dy row dt’ Ennym. Dy jig dty reeriaght. Dt’ aigney dy row jeant er y thalloo, myr te ayns niau. Cur dooin nyn arran jiu as gagh-laa. As leih dooin nyn loghtyn, myr ta shin leih dauesyn ta jannoo loghtyn nyn ’oi. As ny leeid shin ayns miolagh; Agh livrey shin veih olk: Son lhiats y reeriaght, as y phooar, as y ghloyr, son dy-bragh as dy-bragh. Amen.	OUR Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy Name; Thy kingdom come; Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven : Give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.y Creest nyn Jiarn.
English: ALMIGHTY God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who desireth not the death of a sinner, but rather that he may turn from his wickedness, and live; and hath given power and commandment to his Ministers to declare and pronounce to his people, being penitent, the Absolution and Remission of their sins: He pardoneth, and absolveth all them that truly repent, and unfeignedly believe his holy Gospel. Wherefore let us beseech him to grant us true repentance, and his holy Spirit; that those things may please him which we do at this present, and that the rest of our life hereafter may be pure and holy, so that at the last we may come to his eternal joy, through Jesus Christ our Lord.

Manx: O Hiarn, foshil uss nyn meillyn :
English: O Lord, open thou our lips;

Manx: Ans. As nee ny beïll ain soilshaghey magh dty voylley.
English: And our mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

Manx: Priest. O Yee, jean tappeeys dy hauail shin :
English: O God, make speed to save us :

Manx: Ans. O Hiarn, jean siyr dy chooney lhien.
English: O Lord, make haste to help us.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac (sic) : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Ans. Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: Priest. Moylley-jee yn Chiarn.
English: Praise ye the Lord.

Manx: Ans. Ennym y Chiarn dy row er ny voylley.
English: The Lord’s Name be praised.

Manx: O TAR-jee, lhig dooin arrane y ghoaill gys y Chiarn : lhig dooin dy-creeoil boggey ’ghoaill ayns niart nyn saualtys.
English: O COME, let us sing unto the Lord : let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

Manx: Lhig dooin cheet kiongoyrt rish yn enish echey lesh toyrt-booise : as soilshaghey shin hene gennal aynsyn lesh arraneyn-moyllee.
English: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving : and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.

Manx: Son ta’n Chiarn ny Yee mooar : as ny Ree mooar er-skyn dy chooilley Yee.
English: For the Lord is a great God : and a great King above all gods.

Manx: Ayns y laue echeysyn ta ooilley corneilyn y thallooin : as niart ny croink she leshyn eh myrgeddin.
English: In his hand are all the corners of the earth : and the strength of the hills is his also.

Manx: Yn faarkey she leshyn eh, as eh ren eh : as ny laueyn echeysyn ren aarloo yn thalloo chirrym.
English: The sea is his, and he made it : and his hands prepared the dry land.

Manx: O tar-jee, lhig dooin ooashley y choyrt, as tuittym sheese : as gliooney kiongoyrt rish y Chiarn y Fer ren shin.
English: O come, let us worship, and fall down : and kneel before the Lord our Maker.

Manx: Son eshyn y Chiarn y Jee ain : as shinyn pobble e phastyr, as kirree e laue.
English: For he is the Lord our God : and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

Manx: Jiu my nee shiu clashtyn e choraa, ny creoi-jee nyn greeaghyn : myr ayns y vrasnagh, as ayns laa yn violagh ayns yn aasagh;
English: To-day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts : as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness;

Manx: Tra ren ny ayraghyn eu mish y vrasnaghey : phrow ad mee, as honnick ad m’ obbraghyn.
English: When your fathers tempted me : proved me, and saw my works.

Manx: Da-eed bleïn liauyr va mee corree rish y cheeloghe shoh, as dooyrt mee : She pobble ad ta goll er-shaghryn ayns nyn greeaghyn, son cha vel enney er ve oc er my raaidyn.
English: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation, and said : It is a people that do err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways.

Manx: Dauesyn loo mee ayns my chorree : nagh ragh ad stiagh ayns m’ ea.
English: Unto whom I sware in my wrath : that they should not enter into my rest.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Ans. Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: TA shin dy dty voylley, O Yee : ta shin goaill rhyts dy ve yn Chiarn.
English: WE praise thee, O God : we acknowledge thee to be the Lord.

Manx: Ta ooilley yn seihll cur ooashley dhyts : yn Ayr dy-bragh farraghtyn.
English: All the earth doth worship thee : the Father everlasting.

Manx: Hoods ta ooilley ny ainlyn geamagh dy-ard : ny niaughyn, as ooilley ny pooaraghyn t’ayndoo.
English: To thee all Angels cry aloud : the heavens, and all the Powers therein.

Manx: Hoods ta Cherubin as Seraphin : kinjagh geamagh,
English: To thee Cherubin and Seraphin : continually do cry,

Manx: Casherick, casherick, casherick : Hiarn Yee jeh Sheshaght-caggee flaunys.
English: Holy, Holy, Holy : Lord God of Sabaoth.

Manx: Ta niau as thalloo laane jeh ard-ooashley dty ghloyr.
English: Heaven, and Earth are full of the majesty : of thy glory.

Manx: Ta’n cheshaght ghloyroil jeh ny Ostyllyn dy dty voylley.
English: The glorious company of the Apostles : praise thee.

Manx: Ta’n cheshaght vie jeh ny Phadeyryn : cur moylley dhyt.
English: The goodly fellowship of the Prophets : praise thee.

Manx: Ta’n cheshaght-chaggee ooasle jeusyn hur baase son nyn gredjue : dy dty voylley.
English: The noble army of Martyrs : praise thee.

Manx: Ta’n Agglish casherick trooid magh ooilley’n seihll : goaill rhyts;
English: The holy Church throughout all the world : doth acknowledge thee;

Manx: Yn Ayr : jeh Ard-ooashley er-skyn-earroo;
English: The Father : of an infinite Majesty;

Manx: Dty Vac onnoroil, firrinagh : as ynrycan;
English: Thine honourable, true : and only Son;

Manx: Myrgeddin y Spyrryd Noo : Fer-ny-gherjagh.
English: Also the Holy Ghost : the Comforter.

Manx: She uss Ree ny ghloyr : O Chreest.
English: Thou art the King of Glory : O Christ.

Manx: Uss yn Mac dy-bragh farraghtyn : jeh’n Ayr.
English: Thou art the everlasting Son : of the Father.

Manx: Tra ghow uss ort dy livrey dooinney : cha dug oo feoh da breïn y Voidyn.
English: When thou tookest upon thee to deliver man : thou didst not abhor the Virgin’s womb.

Manx: Tra vow er gheddyn barriaght er gyerid y vaaish : doshil oo reeriaght niau dauesyn ooilley ta credjal.
English: When thou hadst overcome the sharpness of death : thou didst open the Kingdom of Heaven to all believers.

Manx: T’ow dy hoie[1] ec laue yesh Yee : ayns gloyr yn Ayr.
English: Thou sittest at the right hand of God : in the glory of the Father.

Manx: Ta shin credjal dy jig uss : dy ve nyn Mriw.
English: We believe that thou shalt come : to be our Judge.

Manx: Ta shin er-y-fa shen guee ort, dy chooney lesh dty harvaantyn : t’ow er chionnaghey reesht lesh dt’ ooill smoo ooasle.
English: We therefore pray thee, help thy servants : whom thou hast redeemed with thy precious Blood.

Manx: Cur orroo dy ve er nyn earroo marish dty Nooghyn : ayns gloyr dy-bragh farraghtyn.
English: Make them to be numbered with thy saints : in glory everlasting.

Manx: O Hiarn, saue dty phobble : as bannee dt’ eiraght.
English: O Lord, save thy people : and bless thine heritage.

Manx: Reill ad : as trog ad seose son dy-bragh.
English: Govern them : and lift them up for ever.

Manx: Laa lurg laa : ta shin coyrt ard-voylley dhyt;
English: Day by day : we magnify thee;

Manx: As ta shin cur ooashley da dt’ Ennym : dy-bragh seihll gyn jerrey.
English: And we worship thy Name : ever world without end.

Manx: Dy gooidsave lhiat, O Hiarn : dy reayll shin jiu fegooish peccah.
English: Vouchsafe, O Lord : to keep us this day without sin.

Manx: O Hiarn, jean myghin orrin : jean myghin orrin.
English: O Lord, have mercy upon us : have mercy upon us.

Manx: O Hiarn, lhig da dty vyghin ve soilshit orrin : myr ta nyn dreishteil ayn-yds.
English: O Lord, let thy mercy lighten upon us : as our trust is in thee.

Manx: O Hiarn, ayn-yds ta mee er choyrt my hreishteil : ny lhig dou dy-bragh ve er my choyrt mow.
English: O Lord, in thee have I trusted : let me never be confounded.

Manx: O OOILLEY shiuish obbraghyn y Chiarn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ALL ye Works of the Lord, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Ainlyn y Chiarn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Angels of the Lord, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Niaughyn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Heavens, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Ushtaghyn ta er-skyn yn aer, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Waters that be above the Firmament, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O ooilley shiuish Pooaraghyn y Chiarn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O all ye Powers of the Lord, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Ghrian as Eayst, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Sun and Moon, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Rollageyn niau, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Stars of Heaven, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Frassyn as Druight, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Showers and Dew, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Geayghyn Yee, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Winds of God, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Aile as Chiass, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Fire and Heat, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Geurey as Sourey, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Winter and Summer, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Druight as Lieh-rio, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Dews and Frosts, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Rio as Feayraght, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Frost and Cold, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Rio as Sniaghtey, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Ice and Snow, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Oieghyn as Laghyn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Nights and Days, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Soilshey as Dorraghys, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Light and Darkness, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Tendeil as Bodjallyn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Lightnings and Clouds, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O lhig da’n Thalloo yn Chiarn y vannaghey : dy-jarroo, lhig da moylley as ard-voylley y choyrt da son dy bragh.
English: O let the Earth bless the Lord : yea, let it praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Sleïtyn as Croink, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Mountains and Hills, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O ooilley shiuish Glassyraght y thallooin, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O all ye Green Things upon the Earth, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Farraneyn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Wells, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Faarkaghyn as Thooillaghyn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Seas and Floods, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Whaleyn, as ooilley ny ta snaue ayns ny ushtaghyn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Whales, and all that move in the waters, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O ooilley shiuish Eeanlee’n aer, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O all ye Fowls of the Air, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O ooilley shiuish Beïyn as Ollagh, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O all ye Beasts and Cattle, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Chloan Gheiney, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Children of Men, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O lhig da Israel yn Chiarn y vannaghey : lhig da moylley as ard-voylley y choyrt da son dy bragh.
English: O let Israel bless the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Saggyrtyn y Chiarn, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Priests of the Lord, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Sharvaantyn y Chiarn, bannee-jee y Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye servants of the Lord, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish Spyrrydyn as Anmeenyn y chloan chairal, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Spirits and Souls of the righteous, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O shiuish gheiney Crauee as Imlee ayns cree, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O ye Holy and Humble Men of heart, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: O Ananias, Azarias, as Misael, bannee-jee yn Chiarn : moylley-jee eh, as cur-jee ard-voylley da son dy bragh.
English: O Ananias, Azarias, and Misael, bless ye the Lord : praise him, and magnify him for ever.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: BANNIT dy row yn Chiarn Jee d’ Israel : son t’eh er yeeaghyn er, as er chionnaghey reesht e phobble;
English: BLESSED be the Lord God of Israel : for he hath visited and redeemed his people.

Manx: As t’eh er hroggal seose saualtys niartal er nyn son : ayns thie e harvaant Ghavid.
English: And hath raised up a mighty salvation for us : in the house of his servant David;

Manx: Myr loayr eh liorish beeal ny Phadeyryn casherick echey : t’er ny ve er dy hoshiaght y theihll;
English: As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets : which have been since the world began;

Manx: Dy beagh shin er nyn sauail veih nyn noidyn : as veih ny laueyn ocsyn ooilley ta dwoaie oc orrin;
English: That we should be saved from our enemies : and from the hand of all that hate us;

Manx: Dy chooilleeney yn vyghin va giallit da ny shenn-ayraghyn ain : as dy chooinaghtyn er e Chonaant casherick;
English: To perform the mercy promised to our forefathers : and to remember his holy covenant;

Manx: Dy chooilleeney yn breearrey ren eh da’n shenn-ayr (sic) ain Abraham : dy giallagh eh dooinyn;
English: To perform the oath which he sware to our forefather Abraham : that he would give us;

Manx: Dy beagh shin er nyn livrey veih laueyn nyn noidyn : as dy shirveishagh shin eh fegooish aggle;
English: That we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies : might serve him without fear;

Manx: Ayns craueeaght as cairys kiongoyrt rish : ooilley laghyn nyn mea.
English: In holiness and righteousness before him : all the days of our life.

Manx: As bee uss, Lhiennoo (sic), enmyssit Phadeyr y Fer-syrjey : son hed oo roish eddin y Chiarn dy yannoo aarloo e raaidyn;
English: And thou, Child, shalt be called the Prophet of the Highest : for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;

Manx: Dy choyrt tushtey dy haualtys da e phobble : liorish leih nyn beccaghyn,
English: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people : for the remission of their sins,

Manx: Trooid myghin meigh yn Jee ain : liorish ta brishey’n laa veih’n yrjid er jeet dy hoilshean orrin;
English: Through the tender mercy of our God : whereby the Day-spring from on high hath visited us.

Manx: Dy chur soilshey dauesyn ta nyn soie ayns dorraghys, as ayns scadoo yn vaaish : as dy leeideil ny cassyn ain gys raad y chee.
English: To give light to them that sit in darkness, and in the shadow of death : and to guide our feet into the way of peace.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: O BEE-jee gerjoil ayns y Chiarn, ooilley shiuish cheeraghyn : shirveish-jee yn Chiarn lesh gennallys, as tar-jee roish e enish lesh arrane.
English: O BE joyful in the Lord, all ye lands : serve the Lord with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

Manx: Bee-jee shickyr dy nee’n Chiarn ta Jee : eshyn t’er n’yannoo shin, as cha nee shin hene, shinyn e phobble, as kirree e phastyr.
English: Be ye sure, that the Lord he is God : it is he that hath made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

Manx: O gow-jee stiagh ayns e yiattyn lesh toyrt-booise, as ayns e choortyn lesh moylley : bee-jee booisal dasyn, as loayr-jee mie jeh’n Ennym echey.
English: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise : be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

Manx: Son ta’n Chiarn graysoil, ta e vyghin son dy-bragh : as ta’n firrinys echey farraghtyn veih sheeloghe gys sheeloghe.
English: For the Lord is gracious, his mercy is everlasting : and his truth endureth from generation to generation.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: TA mee credjal ayns Jee yn Ayr Ooilley-niartal, Chroo niau as thalloo:
English: I BELIEVE in God the Father Almighty, Maker of heaven and earth:

Manx: As ayns Yeesey Creest e ynrycan Vac nyn Jiarn; V’er ny yientyn jeh’n Spyrryd Noo, Rug jeh’n Voidyn Moirrey, Ren surranse fo Pontius Pilate, V’er ny chrossey, er ny varroo, as er ny oanluckey; Hie eh sheese gys niurin; Yn trass laa dirree eh reesht veih ny merriu; Hie eh seose gys niau, As t’eh ny hoie er laue yesh Yee, yn Ayr Ooilley-niartal; Veih shen hig eh dy vriwnys ny bio as ny merriu.
English: And in Jesus Christ his only Son our Lord, Who was conceived by the Holy Ghost, Born of the Virgin Mary, Suffered under Pontius Pilate, Was crucified, dead, and buried: He descended into hell; The third day he rose again from the dead; He ascended into heaven, And sitteth on the right hand of God the Father Almighty; From thence he shall come to judge the quick and the dead.

Manx: Ta mee credjal ayns y Spyrryd Noo; Yn slane Agglish casherick; Sheshaght ny Nooghyn; Leih peccaghyn: Irree-seose reesht y challin; As y vea dy-bragh farraghtyn. Amen.
English: I believe in the Holy Ghost; The holy catholick Church; The communion of Saints; The forgiveness of Sins; The resurrection of the body, And the life everlasting. Amen.

Manx: Yn Chiarn dy row mêriu.
English: The Lord be with you.

Manx: Ans. As marish dty spyrryd.
English: And with thy spirit.

Manx: Minister. Lhig dooin padjer y ghoaill.
English: Let us pray.

Manx: Hiarn, jean myghin orrin.
English: Lord, have mercy upon us.

Manx: Chreest, jean myghin orrin.
English: Christ, have mercy upon us.

Manx: Hiarn, jean myghin orrin.
English: Lord, have mercy upon us.

Manx: AYR ain, t’ayns niau; Casherick dy row dt’ Ennym. Dy jig dty reeriaght. Dt’ aigney dy row jeant er y thalloo, myr te ayns niau. Cur dooin nyn arran jiu as gagh-laa. As leih dooin nyn loghtyn, myr ta shin leih dauesyn ta jannoo loghtyn nyn ’oi. As ny leeid shin ayns miolagh; Agh livrey shin veih olk. Amen.
English: OUR Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy Name; Thy kingdom come; Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven : Give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. Amen.

Manx: O Hiarn, soilshee dty vyghin orrin;
English: O Lord, shew thy mercy upon us;

Manx: Ans. As giall dooin dty haualtys.
English: And grant us thy salvation.

Manx: Priest. O Hiarn, saue yn Ree.
English: O Lord, save the King;

Manx: Ans. As dy-myghinagh clasht rooin tra ta shin geamagh ort.
English: And mercifully hear us when we call upon thee.

Manx: Priest. Coamree dty Hirveishee lesh cairys:
English: Endue thy Ministers with righteousness;

Manx: Ans. As jean dty phobble reiht gerjoil.
English: And make thy chosen people joyful.

Manx: Priest. O Hiarn, saue dty phobble;
English: O Lord, save thy people;

Manx: Ans. As bannee dt’ eiraght.
English: And bless thine inheritance.

Manx: Priest. Cur shee ’sy traa ain, O Hiarn;
English: Give peace in our time, O Lord;

Manx: Ans. Er-y-fa nagh vel fer erbee elley ta caggey er nyn son, agh uss dy-lomarcan, O Yee.
English: Because there is none other that fighteth for us, but only thou, O God.

Manx: Priest. O Yee, jean glen ny creeaghyn ain er cheu-sthie j’in;
English: O God, make clean our hearts within us;

Manx: Ans. As na gow dty Spyrryd Casherick voïn.
English: And take not thy Holy Spirit from us.

Manx: O Yee, bun y chee, as fer graihagh er coardail, ayns tushtey jeed’s ta shassoo yn vea veayn ain, yn chirveish ayds seyrsnys firrinagh; Freill shin dty harvaantyn imlee ayns dy chooilley hoiagh orrin jeh nyn noidyn, dy vod mayd, dy-shickyr treishteil ayns dty endeilys, gyn aggle y ghoaill roish pooar noidyn erbee, trooid niart Yeesey Creest nyn Jiarn. Amen.
English: O GOD, who art the author of peace and lover of concord, in knowledge of whom standeth our eternal life, whose service is perfect freedom; Defend us thy humble servants in all assaults of our enemies; that we surely trusting in thy defence, may not fear the power of any adversaries, through the might of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

Manx: O Hiarn, nyn Ayr flaunyssagh, Ooilley-niartal as Yee dy-bragh farraghtyn, t’er choyrt lhiat shin dy-sauchey gys toshiaght y laa shoh; Freill shin ayns y laa cheddin lesh dty phooar niartal, as giall nagh duitt mayd jiu ayns peccah erbee, cha-moo nagh roih mayd ayns monney erbee dy ghaue; agh dy vod ooilley nyn yannoo v’er ny oardrail liorish dty reill’s, dy yannoo dy-kinjagh shen ny ta cairagh ayns dty hilley, trooid Yeesey Creest nyn Jiarn. Amen.
English: O LORD, our heavenly Father, Almighty and everlasting God, who hast safely brought us to the beginning of this day; Defend us in the same with thy mighty power; and grant that this day we fall into no sin, neither run into any kind of danger; but that all our doings may be ordered by thy governance, to do always that is righteous in thy sight, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

Manx: O Hiarn, nyn Ayr flaunyssagh, ard as niartal, Ree dy reeaghyn, Chiarn dy hiarnyn, yn ynrycan Fer-reill princeyn, ta veih dty stoyl-reeoil cur-my-ner ooilley fir-vaghee’n thallooin; Dy feer creeoil ta shin guee ort lesh dty oayr dy yeeaghyn er y Chiarn as y Ree smoo graysoil ain GEORGE, as myr shen lhieen eh lesh grayse dty Spyrryd Casherick, dy vod eh dy-kinjagh crommey gys dt’ aigney, as gimmeeaght ayns dty raad: Coamree eh dy-palchey lesh giootyn flaunyssagh; giall da ayns slaynt as berchys foddey dy ve bio; niartee eh dy vod eh yn varriaght as laue’n eaghtyr y gheddyn harrish ooilley e noidyn; as ec y jerrey lurg y vea shoh, dy vod eh yn voggey as yn vaynrys dy-bragh farraghtyn y gheddyn, trooid Yeesey Creest nyn Jiarn. Amen.
English: O LORD, our heavenly Father, high and mighty, King of kings, Lord of lords, the only Ruler of princes, who dost from thy throne behold all the dwellers upon earth; Most heartily we beseech thee with thy favour to behold our most gracious Sovereign Lord, King GEORGE; and so replenish him with the grace of thy Holy Spirit, that he may alway incline to thy will, and walk in thy way. Endue him plenteously with heavenly gifts; grant him in health and wealth long to live; strengthen him that he may vanquish and overcome all his enemies; and finally after this life he may attain everlasting joy and felicity, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

Manx: YEE Ooilley-niartal, bun dy chooilley vieys, ta shin dy-imlee guee ort dy vannaghey yn Ven-reïn smoo graysoil ain Charlotte, yn Ard-ooashley Reeoil oc George Prince jeh Wales, yn Princess treoghe jeh Wales as ooilley’n Sluight Reeoil [as maroosyn yn Chiarn, yn Lady, as Fir-reill yn Ellan shoh]:[1] Coamree ad lesh dty Spyrryd Casherick; berchee ad lesh dty ghrayse flaunyssagh; bishee ad lesh dy chooilley vaynrys; as cur lhiat ad gys dty reeriaght dy-bragh farraghtyn, trooid Yeesey Creest nyn Jiarn. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY God, the fountain of all goodness, we humbly beseech thee to bless our gracious Queen Charlotte, their Royal Highnesses George Prince of Wales, the Princess Dowager of Wales, and all the Royal Family: Endue them with thy Holy Spirit; enrich them with thy heavenly grace; prosper them with all happiness; and bring them to thine everlasting kingdom, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

Manx: YEE Ooilley-niartal, as dy-bragh farraghtyn, ta dy-lomarcan gobbraghey yindyssyn mooarey; Cur neose er ny Aspickyn as ny Shirveishee ain, as er dy chooilley Heshaght t’er ny choyrt fo’n churrym oc, yn Spyrryd slayntoil jeh dty ghrayse; as dy vod ad dy-firrinagh uss y wooiys, cur neose orroo yn druight kinjagh jeh dty vannaght. Giall shoh, O Hiarn, son yn onnor echeysyn ta loayrt er nyn son as ta eddyr shin, Yeesey Creest. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY and everlasting God, who alone workest great marvels: Send down upon our Bishops, and Curates, and all Congregations committed to their charge, the healthful Spirit of thy grace; and that they may truly please thee, pour upon them the continual dew of thy blessing. Grant this, O Lord, for the honour of our Advocate and Mediator, Jesus Christ. Amen.

Manx: YEE Ooilley-niartal, t’er choyrt dooinyn grayse ec y traa shoh, lesh un aigney dy yannoo nyn aghinyn cadjin hoods; as t’ow gialldyn, tra ta ghaa ny three er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ayns dt’ Ennym’s, dy der uss dauesyn nyn aghinyn: Cooilleen nish, O Hiarn, yeearreeyn as accanyn dty harvaantyn, myr smoo hee uss ymmyrchagh er nyn son; gialldyn dooin ’sy theihll shoh tushtey jeh dt’ irriney, as ayns y theihll ta ry heet yn vea dy-bragh farraghtyn. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY God, who hast given us grace at this time with one accord to make our common supplications unto thee; and dost promise, that when two or three are gathered together in thy Name, thou wilt grant their requests; Fulfil now, O Lord, the desires and petitions of thy servants, as may be most expedient for them; granting us in this world knowledge of thy truth, and in the world to come life everlasting. Amen.

Manx: Grayse nyn Jiarn Yeesey Creest, as graih Yee, as sheshaght gherjoil y Spyrryd Noo, dy row mârin ooilley er son dy-bragh. Amen.
English: THE grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Ghost, be with us all evermore. Amen.

Manx: TRA ta’n dooinney mee-chrauee chyndaa ersooyl veih’n vee-chraueeaght t’eh er ny ve cur rish, as jannoo shen ta cairagh as jeeragh, sauee eh e annym bio. Ezek. 18. 27.
English: WHEN the wicked man turneth away from his wickedness that he hath committed, and doeth that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul alive.

Manx: Ta mee goaill-rish m’ oiljyn, as ta my pheccah kinjagh kiongoyrt rhym. Psal. 51. 3.
English: I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me.

Manx: Follee dty eddin veih my pheccaghyn, as leih dou ooilley my vee-chraueeaght. Psal. 51. 9.
English: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out mine iniquities.

Manx: Ta ourallyn Yee spyrryd seaghnit; cree brisht as arryssagh, O Yee, cha soie uss beg jeh. Psal. 51. 17.
English: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit : a broken and a contrite heart, O God, Thou wilt not despise.

Manx: Raip-jee nyn greeaghyn, as cha nee nyn goamraghyn, as chyndaa-jee gys y Chiarn y Jee eu: son t’eh graysoil as myghinagh, moal gys corree, as chenjallys vooar, as meigh-chreeagh tra t’eh kerraghey. Joel 2. 13.
English: Rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the Lord your God: for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth him of the evil.

Manx: Gys y Chiarn y jee ain ta bentyn myghinyn as leih peccaghyn, ga dy vel shin er n’irree magh n’ oi : cha-moo ta shin er choyrt biallys da coraa yn Chiarn y Jee ain, dy immeeaght ayns e leighaghyn t’eh er hoiaghey roïn. Dan. 9. 9, 10.
English: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses, though we have rebelled against him : neither have we obeyed the voice of the Lord our God, to walk in his laws, which He set before us.

Manx: O Hiarn, smaghtee mee, agh lesh foayr; cha nee ayns dty chorree, er aggle dy der oo lhiat mee gys veg. Jer. 10. 24. Psal. 6. 1.
English: O Lord, correct me, but with judgement; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

Manx: Gow-jee arrys; son ta reeriaght niau er-gerrey. Mat. 3. 2.
English: Repent ye; for the Kingdom of heaven is at hand.

Manx: Trog-ym’s orrym, as hem roym gys m’ ayr, as jir-ym rish, Ayr, ta mee er n’yannoo peccah noi niau, as kiongoyrt rhyts, as cha vel mee ny sodjey feeu dy ve enmyssit dty vac. Luke 15. 18, 19.
English: I will arise and go to my father, and will say unto him; Father, I have sinned against Heaven, and before thee, and am no more worthy to be called thy son.

Manx: Ny gow er dty hoshiaght gys briwnys rish dty harvaant, O Hiarn; son ayns dty hilley’s cha bee dooinney erbee bio er ny heyrey. Psal. 143. 2
English: Enter not into judgement with Thy servant, O Lord; for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

Manx: My ta shin gra dy vel shin gyn peccah, ta shin molley shin hene, as cha vel yn irriney ain. Agh my ta shin goaill-rish nyn beccaghyn, t’eshyn firrinagh as cairagh dy leih dooin nyn beccaghyn, as dy ghlenney shin veih dy chooilley neu-ynrickys. 1 John 1. 8, 9.
English: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us. But if we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

Manx: CHAARJYN ghraihagh, ta Goo Yee dy choyrlaghey shin ayns ymmodee ynnydyn dy hoilshaghey as dy ghoaill-rish nyn ymmodee filley peccaghyn as olkys, as nagh lhisagh shin ad y cheiltyn ny ’choodaghey kiongoyrt rish eddin Yee Ooilley-niartal nyn Ayr flaunyssagh, agh goaill roo lesh cree imlee, injil, arryssagh as ammyssagh, dy vod mayd leih y gheddyn er nyn son, liorish e vieys as e vyghin er-skyn-earroo. As ga dy lhisagh shin ec dy chooilley hraa dy-imlee goaill-rish nyn beccaghyn kiongoyrt rish Jee, foast lhisagh shin er-skyn ooilley shen y yannoo, tra ta shin chaglym as meeteil cooidjagh, dy choyrt booise son ny toyrtyssyn mooarey ta shin er gheddyn veih e laueyn, dy hoiaghey magh e voylley smoo feeu, dy eaishtagh rish e Ghoo smoo casherick, as dy yeearree ny reddyn shen ta fêmoil as ymmyrchagh, chammah son y chorp as yn annym. Shen-y-fa ta mee guee as geearree erriu, whilleen as t’ayns shoh kionfenish, dy yannoo sheshaght mâryms lesh cree glen, as coraa imlee, gys stoyl-reeoil yn ghrayse flaunyssagh, gra my yeih’s:
English: DEARLY beloved brethren, the Scripture moveth us in sundry places to acknowledge and confess our manifold sins and wickedness; and that we should not dissemble nor cloke them before the face of Almighty God our heavenly Father; but confess them with an humble, lowly, penitent, and obedient heart; to the end that we may obtain forgiveness of the same, by his infinite goodness and mercy. And although we ought at all times humbly to acknowledge our sins before God; yet ought we most chiefly so to do, when we assemble, and meet together, to render thanks for the great benefits that we have received at His hands, to set forth his most worthy praise, to hear his most holy Word, and to ask those things which are requisite and necessary, as well for the body as the soul. Wherefore I pray, and beseech you, as many as are here present, to accompany me with a pure heart, and humble voice, unto the throne of the heavenly grace, saying after me:

Manx: AYR Ooilley-niartal as smoo laane jeh dty vyghin; Ta shin er n’gholl er-shaghryn veih dty raaidyn casley rish kirree cailjey. Ta shin er eiyrt rouyr er smooinaghtyn as yeearreeyn ny creeaghyn ain hene. Ta shin er n’yannoo peccah noi dty leighaghyn casherick. Ta shin er n’aagail gyn jannoo ny reddyn shen lhisagh shin v’er n’yannoo; As ta shin er n’yannoo ny reddyn shen nagh lhisagh shin v’er n’yannoo; As cha vel slaynt erbee aynin. Agh uss, O Hiarn, jean myghin orrin peccee hreih. Ymmyrk uss lhieusyn, O Yee, ta goaill-rish nyn voiljyn. Gow uss adsyn reesht ta arryssagh; Cordail rish dty yialdynyn er ny hoilshaghey da sheelnaue ayns Creest Yeesey nyn Jiarn. As giall, O Ayr smoo laane jeh dty vyghin, er y ghraih echeysyn; Dy vod mayd ny yeih shoh beaghey dy-crauee, dy-cairal, as dy-sheelt, Gys gloyr dt’ Ennym’s casherick. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY and most merciful Father; We have erred, and strayed from thy ways like lost sheep; We have followed too much the devices and desires of our own hearts; We have offended against thy holy laws: We have left undone those things, which we ought to have done; And we have done those things which we ought not to have done; And there is no health in us. But thou, O Lord, have mercy upon us, miserable offenders; Spare thou them, O God, which confess their faults: Restore thou them that are penitent; According to thy promises declared unto mankind in Christ Jesu our Lord. And grant, O most merciful Father, for his sake, That we may hereafter live a godly, righteous, and sober life, To the glory of thy holy Name. Amen.

Manx: JEE Ooilley-niartal, Ayr nyn Jiarn Yeesey Creest, nagh vel shirrey baase peccagh, agh baare lesh eh dy hyndaa veih’n olkys echey, as ve bio; as ta er choyrt pooar as saarey da e Hirveishee, dy hoilshaghey as d’ ockley magh da e phobble, ta arryssagh, pardoon as leih son nyn beccaghyn: T’eh pardooney as leih dauesyn ooilley ta dy-firrinagh goaill arrys, as dy-shickyr credjal e Hushtal casherick. Shen-y-fa lhig dooin guee ersyn dy choyrt dooin arrys firrinagh, as e Spyrryd Casherick, dy vod ny reddyn shen eshyn y wooiys ta shin jannoo ec y traa shoh, as dy vod y chooid elley jeh’n vea ain ny yeih shoh ve glen as crauee; myr shen ec y jerrey dy vod mayd cheet gys e voggey dy-bragh beayn, trooid Yeesey Creest nyn Jiarn.
English: ALMIGHTY God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who desireth not the death of a sinner, but rather that he may turn from his wickedness, and live; and hath given power and commandment to his Ministers to declare and pronounce to his people, being penitent, the Absolution and Remission of their sins: He pardoneth, and absolveth all them that truly repent, and unfeignedly believe his holy Gospel. Wherefore let us beseech him to grant us true repentance, and his holy Spirit; that those things may please him which we do at this present, and that the rest of our life hereafter may be pure and holy, so that at the last we may come to his eternal joy, through Jesus Christ our Lord.

Manx: AYR ain, t’ayns niau; Casherick dy row dt’ Ennym. Dy jig dty reeriaght. Dt’ aigney dy row jeant er y thalloo, myr te ayns niau. Cur dooin nyn arran jiu as gagh-laa. As leih dooin nyn loghtyn, myr ta shin leih dauesyn ta jannoo loghtyn nyn ’oi. As ny leeid shin ayns miolagh; Agh livrey shin veih olk: Son lhiats y reeriaght, as y phooar, as y ghloyr, son dy-bragh as dy-bragh. Amen.
English: OUR Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy Name; Thy kingdom come; Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven : Give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, But deliver us from evil : For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.

Manx: O Hiarn, foshil uss nyn meillyn:
English: O Lord, open thou our lips;

Manx: Ans. As nee ny beïll ain soilshaghey magh dty voylley.
English: And our mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

Manx: Priest. O Yee, jean tappeeys dy hauail shin;
English: O God, make speed to save us;

Manx: Ans. O Hiarn, jean siyr dy chooney lhien.
English: O Lord, make haste to help us.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Ans. Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: Priest. Moylley-jee yn Chiarn.
English: Praise ye the Lord.

Manx: Ans. Ennym y Chiarn dy row er ny voylley.
English: The Lord’s Name be praised.

Manx: TA m’ annym cur ard-voylley da’n Chiarn : as ta my spyrryd er ghoaill boggey ayns Jee my Haualtagh.
English: MY soul doth magnify the Lord : and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Saviour.

Manx: Son t’eh er choyrt tastey da stayd injil e inney-veyl.
English: For he hath regarded : the lowliness of his hand-maiden.

Manx: Son cur-my-ner, maghey shoh: nee dy chooilley heeloghe mish y enmys bannit.
English: For behold, from henceforth : all generations shall call me blessed.

Manx: Son t’eshyn ta niartal er n’yannoo reddyn mooarey er my hon: as casherick ta e Ennym.
English: For he that is mighty hath magnified me : and holy is his Name.

Manx: As ta e vyghin orroosyn ta goaill aggle roish: veih sheeloghe gys sheeloghe.
English: And his mercy is on them that fear him : throughout all generations.

Manx: T’eh er hoilshaghey niart lesh e roih : t’eh er skeayley yn vooinjer voyrnagh ayns smooinaghtyn nyn greeaghyn.
English: He hath shewed strength with his arm : he hath scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.

Manx: T’eh er choyrt sheese yn vooinjer niartal veih ny stuill oc : as er hoiaghey seose adsyn ta imlee as meen.
English: He hath put down the mighty from their seat : and hath exalted the humble and meek.

Manx: T’eh er lhieeney ny accryssee lesh reddyn mie : as ny berchee t’eh chur ersooyl follym.
English: He hath filled the hungry with good things : and the rich he hath sent empty away.

Manx: Ayns cooinaghtyn jeh e vyghin, t’eh er chooney lesh e harvaant Israel : myr yiall eh da ny shenn-ayraghyn ain, Abraham as e lhuight son dy-bragh.
English: He remembering his mercy hath holpen his servant Israel : as he promised to our forefathers, Abraham and his seed for ever.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: O Gow-jee arrane noa gys y Chiarn : son t’eh er n’yannoo reddyn yindyssagh.
English: O SING unto the Lord a new song : for he hath done marvellous things.

Manx: Lesh e laue yesh hene, as lesh e roih casherick : t’eh er gheddyn da hene yn varriaght.
English: With his own right hand, and with his holy arm : hath he gotten himself the victory.

Manx: Ta’n Chiarn er hoilshaghey e haualtys : e chairys t’eh er hoiaghey magh dy-foshlit ayns shilley ny ashoonyn.
English: The Lord declared his salvation : his righteousness hath he openly shewed in the sight of the heathen.

Manx: T’eh er chooinaghtyn er e vyghin as e ynrickys gys thie Israel : as ta ny ardjyn sodjey mooie jeh’n theihll er vakin saualtys y Jee ain.
English: He hath remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel : and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.

Manx: Jeeagh-jee shiu hene gennal gys y Chiarn, ooilley shiuish cheeraghyn : gow-jee arrane, gow-jee boggey, as cur-jee booise.
English: Shew yourselves joyful unto the Lord, all ye lands : sing, rejoice, and give thanks.

Manx: Moylley-jee y Chiarn er y chlaasagh : gow-jee arrane marish y chlaasagh lesh psalm dy hoyrt-booise.
English: Praise the Lord upon the harp : sing to the harp with a psalm of thanksgiving;

Manx: Lesh cayrnyn myrgeddin as shawmyn : O jeeagh-jee shiu hene gennal kiongoyrt rish y Chiarn y Ree.
English: With trumpets also and shawms : O shew yourselves joyful before the Lord the King.

Manx: Lhig da’n faarkey feiyr y yannoo, as ooilley ny t’ayn : yn seihll cruïnn, as adsyn ta vaghey ayn.
English: Let the sea make a noise, and all that therein is : the round world, and they that dwell therein.

Manx: Lhig da ny thooillaghyn nyn massyn y woalley, as lhig da ny croink ve gennal cooidjagh kiongoyrt rish y Chiarn : son t’eh cheet dy vriwnys y thalloo.
English: Let the floods clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the Lord : for he cometh to judge the earth.

Manx: Lesh ynrickys nee eh yn seihll y vriwnys : as y pobble lesh cairys.
English: With righteousness shall he judge the world : and the people with equity.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: HIARN, nish t’ow cur kied da dty harvaant paartail ayns shee : cordail rish dty ghoo.
English: LORD, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace : according to thy word.

Manx: Son ta my hooillyn er vakin dty haualtys;
English: For mine eyes have seen : thy salvation;

Manx: T’ow er n’yannoo aarloo : kiongoyrt rish dy chooilley phobble;
English: Which thou hast prepared : before the face of all people;

Manx: Dy ve son soilshey dy hoilshaghey ny Ashoonyn-quaagh : as gloyr dty phobble Israel.
English: To be a light to lighten the Gentiles : and to be the glory of thy people Israel.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: DY row Jee myghinagh dooin, as dy bannee eh shin : as soilshey e eddin y yeeaghyn dooin, as dy row eh myghinagh dooin.
English: GOD be merciful unto us, and bless us : and shew us the light of his countenance, and be merciful unto us:

Manx: Dy vod enney v’er ny choyrt er dty raad er y thalloo : dty haualtys anmey mastey dy chooilley ashoon.
English: That thy way may be known upon earth : thy saving health among all nations.

Manx: Lhig da’n pobble (sic) uss y voylley, O Yee : dy-jarroo, lhig da ooilley’n pobble moylley ’choyrt dhyt.
English: Let the people praise thee, O God : yea, let all the people praise thee.

Manx: O lhig da ny ashoonyn boggey ’ghoaill as ve gennal : son nee uss y pobble y vriwnys dy-cairal, as ny ashoonyn y reill er y thalloo.
English: O let the nations rejoice and be glad : for thou shalt judge the folk righteously, and govern the nations upon earth.

Manx: Lhig da’n pobble (sic) uss y voylley, O Yee : dy-jarroo, lhig da ooilley’n pobble moylley ’choyrt dhyt.
English: Let the people praise thee, O God : yea, let all the people praise thee.

Manx: Eisht nee’n thalloo cur magh y bishaghey : as nee Jee, dy-jarroo yn Jee ain, e vannaght y choyrt dooin.
English: Then shall the earth bring forth her increase : and God, even our own God, shall give us his blessing.

Manx: Nee jee shin y vannaghey : as nee dy chooilley chione jeh’n seihll (sic) aggle y ghoaill roish.
English: God shall bless us : and all the ends of the world shall fear him.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: TA mee credjal ayns Jee yn Ayr Ooilley-niartal, Chroo niau as thalloo.
English: I BELIEVE in God the Father Almighty, Maker of heaven and earth:

Manx: As ayns Yeesey Creest e ynrycan Vac nyn Jiarn; V’er ny yientyn jeh’n Spyrryd Noo, Rug jeh’n Voidyn Moirrey, Ren surranse fo Pontius Pilate, V’er ny chrossey, er ny varroo, as er ny oanluckey; Hie eh sheese gys niurin; Yn trass laa dirree eh reesht veih ny merriu; Hie eh seose gys niau, As t’eh ny hoie er laue yesh Yee, yn Ayr Ooilley-niartal; Veih shen hig eh dy vriwnys ny bio as ny merriu.
English: And in Jesus Christ his only Son our Lord, Who was conceived by the Holy Ghost, Born of the Virgin Mary, Suffered under Pontius Pilate, Was crucified, dead, and buried: He descended into hell; The third day he rose again from the dead; He ascended into heaven, And sitteth on the right hand of God the Father Almighty; From thence he shall come to judge the quick and the dead.

Manx: Ta mee credjal ayns y Spyrryd Noo; Yn slane Agglish casherick; Sheshaght ny Nooghyn; Leih peccaghyn: Irree-seose-reesht y challin; As y vea dy-bragh farraghtyn. Amen.
English: I believe in the Holy Ghost; The holy catholick Church; The communion of Saints; The forgiveness of Sins; The resurrection of the body, And the life everlasting. Amen.

Manx: Yn Chiarn dy row mêriu.
English: The Lord be with you.

Manx: Ans. As marish dty spyrryd.
English: And with thy spirit.

Manx: Minister. Lhig dooin padjer y ghoaill.
English: Let us pray.

Manx: Hiarn, jean myghin orrin.
English: Lord, have mercy upon us.

Manx: Chreest, jean myghin orrin.
English: Christ, have mercy upon us.

Manx: Hiarn, jean myghin orrin.
English: Lord, have mercy upon us.

Manx: AYR ain, t’ayns niau; Casherick dy row dt’ Ennym. Dy jig dty reeriaght. Dt’ aigney dy row jeant er y thalloo, myr te ayns niau. Cur dooin nyn arran jiu as gagh-laa. As leih dooin nyn loghtyn, myr ta shin leih dauesyn ta jannoo loghtyn nyn ’oi. As ny leeid shin ayns miolagh; Agh livrey shin veih olk. Amen.
English: OUR Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy Name; Thy kingdom come; Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven : Give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive them that trespass against us; And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. Amen.

Manx: O Hiarn, soilshee dty vyghin orrin;
English: O Lord, shew thy mercy upon us;

Manx: Ans. As giall dooin dty haualtys.
English: And grant us thy salvation.

Manx: Priest. O Hiarn, saue yn Ree;
English: O Lord, save the King;

Manx: Ans. As dy-myghinagh clasht rooin tra ta shin geamagh ort.
English: And mercifully hear us when we call upon thee.

Manx: Priest. Coamree dty Hirveishee lesh cairys:
English: Endue thy Ministers with righteousness;

Manx: Ans. As jean dty phobble reiht gerjoil.
English: And make thy chosen people joyful.

Manx: Priest. O Hiarn, saue dty phobble;
English: O Lord, save thy people;

Manx: Ans. As bannee dt’ eiraght.
English: And bless thine inheritance.

Manx: Priest. Cur shee ’sy traa ain, O Hiarn;
English: Give peace in our time, O Lord;

Manx: Ans. Er-y-fa nagh vel fer erbee elley ta caggey er nyn son, agh uss dy-lomarcan, O Yee.
English: Because there is none other that fighteth for us, but only thou, O God.

Manx: Priest. O Yee, jean glen ny creeaghyn ain er cheu-sthie j’in;
English: O God, make clean our hearts within us;

Manx: Ans. As ny gow dty Spyrryd Casherick voïn.
English: And take not thy Holy Spirit from us.

Manx: O Yee, voïds ta dy-chooiley yeearree casherick, dy-chooilley  choyrle vie, as dy-chooilley obbyr cairagh cheet; Cur dooinyn dty harvaantyn yn shee shen nagh vod y seill y choyrt; dy vod chammah ny creeaghyn ain ve soit dy chur biallys da dt’ annaghyn, as myrgeddin shinyn er nyn vendeil liorts vieh aggle nyn noïdyn, dy vod mayd nyn draa y choyrt shaghey ayns fea as shee, trooid toilchinys Yeesey Creest nyn Saualtagh. Amen.
English: O GOD, from whom all holy desires, all good counsels, and all just works do proceed; Give unto thy servants that peace which the world cannot give; that both our hearts may be set to obey thy commandments, and also that by thee we being defended from the fear of our enemies, may pass our time in rest and quietness, through the merits of Jesus Christ our Saviour. Amen.

Manx: SOILSHEE yn dorraghys ain, ta shin guee ort, O Hiarn; as jeh dty vyghin vooar freill shin veih dy-chooilley ghaue as dangere jeh’n oie shoh, er graih dty Vac ynrycan nyn Saualtagh Yeesey Creest. Amen.
English: LIGHTEN our darkness, we beseech thee, O Lord; and by thy great mercy defend us from all perils and dangers of this night, for the love of thy only Son our Saviour Jesus Christ. Amen.

Manx: O Hiarn, nyn Ayr flaunyssagh, ard as niartal, Ree dy reeaghyn, Chiarn dy hiarnyn, yn ynrycan Fer-reill princeyn, ta veih dty stoyl-reeoil cur-my-ner ooilley fir-vaghee’n thallooin; Dy feer creeoil ta shin guee ort lesh dty oayr dy yeeaghyn er y Chiarn as y Ree smoo graysoil ain GEORGE, as myr shen lhieen eh lesh grayse dty Spyrryd Casherick, dy vod eh dy-kinjagh crommey gys dt’ aigney, as gimmeeaght ayns dty raad: Coamree eh dy-palchey lesh giootyn flaunyssagh; giall da ayns slaynt as berchys foddey dy ve bio; niartee eh dy vod eh yn varriaght as laue’n eaghtyr y gheddyn harrish ooilley e noidyn; as ec y jerrey lurg y vea shoh, dy vod eh yn voggey as yn vaynrys dy-bragh farraghtyn y gheddyn, trooid Yeesey Creest nyn Jiarn. Amen.
English: O LORD, our heavenly Father, high and mighty, King of kings, Lord of lords, the only Ruler of princes, who dost from thy throne behold all the dwellers upon earth; Most heartily we beseech thee with thy favour to behold our most gracious Sovereign Lord, King GEORGE; and so replenish him with the grace of thy Holy Spirit, that he may alway incline to thy will, and walk in thy way. Endue him plenteously with heavenly gifts; grant him in health and wealth long to live; strengthen him that he may vanquish and overcome all his enemies; and finally after this life he may attain everlasting joy and felicity, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

Manx: YEE Ooilley-niartal, bun dy-chooilley vieys, ta shin dy-imlee guee ort dy vannaghey yn Ven-reïn smoo graysoil ain Charlotte, yn Ard-ooashley Reeoil oc George Prince jeh Wales, yn Princess treoghe jeh Wales, as ooilley’n Sluight Reeoil [as maroosyn yn Chiarn, yn Lady, as Fir-reill yn Ellan shoh[1]]; Coamree ad lesh dty Spyrryd Casherick; berchee ad lesh dty ghrayse flaunyssagh; bishee ad lesh dy-chooilley vaynrys; as cur lhiat ad gys dty reeriaght dy-bragh farraghtyn, trooid Yeesey Creest nyn Jiarn. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY God, the fountain of all goodness, we humbly beseech thee to bless our gracious Queen Charlotte, their Royal Highnesses George Prince of Wales, the Princess Dowager of Wales, and all the Royal Family: Endue them with thy Holy Spirit; enrich them with thy heavenly grace; prosper them with all happiness; and bring them to thine everlasting kingdom, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

Manx: YEE Ooilley-niartal, as dy-bragh farraghtyn, ta dy-lomarcan gobbraghey yindyssyn mooarey; Cur neose er ny Aspickyn as ny Shirveishee ain, as er dy-chooilley Heshaght t’er ny choyrt fo’n churrym oc, yn Spyrryd slayntoil jeh dty ghrayse; as dy vod ad dy-firrinagh uss y wooiys, cur neose orroo yn druight kinjagh jeh dty vannaght. Giall shoh, O Hiarn, son yn onnor echeysyn ta loayrt er nyn son as ta eddyr shin, Yeesey Creest. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY and everlasting God, who alone workest great marvels: Send down upon our Bishops, and Curates, and all Congregations committed to their charge, the healthful Spirit of thy grace; and that they may truly please thee, pour upon them the continual dew of thy blessing. Grant this, O Lord, for the honour of our Advocate and Mediator, Jesus Christ. Amen.

Manx: YEE Ooilley-niartal, t’er choyrt dooinyn grayse ec y traa shoh, lesh un aigney dy yannoo nyn aghinyn cadjin hoods; as t’ow gialldyn, tra ta ghaa ny three er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ayns dt’ Ennym’s, dy der uss dauesyn nyn aghinyn: Cooilleen nish, O Hiarn, yeearreeyn as accanyn dty harvaantyn, myr smoo hee uss ymmyrchagh er nyn son; gialldyn dooin ’sy theihll shoh tushtey jey dt’ irriney, as ayns y theihll ta ry heet yn vea dy-bragh farraghtyn. Amen.
English: ALMIGHTY God, who hast given us grace at this time with one accord to make our common supplications unto thee; and dost promise, that when two or three are gathered together in thy Name, thou wilt grant their requests; Fulfil now, O Lord, the desires and petitions of thy servants, as may be most expedient for them; granting us in this world knowledge of thy truth, and in the world to come life everlasting. Amen.

Manx: GRAYSE nyn Jiarn Yeesey Creest, as graih Yee, as sheshaght gherjoil y Spyrryd Noo, dy row mârin ooilley er son dy-bragh. Amen.
English: THE grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Ghost, be with us all evermore. Amen.

Manx: QUOI-erbee saillish dy v’er ny hauail : roish dy-chooilley nhee te ymmyrchagh dy gum eh yn Credjue Cadjin [Creestee].
English: WHOSOEVER will be saved : before all things it is necessary that he hold the Catholick Faith.

Manx: Yn Credjue cheddin, mannagh jean dagh unnane y reayll slane as glen : fêgooish dooyt nee eh cherraghtyn son dy-bragh.
English: Which Faith, except every one do keep whole and undefiled : without doubt he shall perish everlastingly.

Manx: As shoh yn Credjue Cadjin : Dy der mayd ooashley da un Jee ayns y Trinaid, as da’n Trinaid ayns Unnaneys;
English: And the Catholick Faith is this : That we worship one God in Trinity, and Trinity in Unity;

Manx: Cha nee goaill yn derrey Phersoon son y Persoon elley : ny scarrey yn Vree.
English: Neither confounding the Persons : nor dividing the Substance.

Manx: Son t’ayn un Phersoon jeh’n Ayr, Persoon elley jeh’n Mac: as Persoon elley jeh’n Spyrryd Noo.
English: For there is one Person of the Father, another of the Son : and another of the Holy Ghost.

Manx: Agh ta Jeeys yn Ayr, yn Mac, as y Spyrryd Noo, ooilley unnane : yn Ghloyr corrym, yn Ard-ooashley co-beayn.
English: But the Godhead of the Father, of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost, is all one : the Glory equal, the Majesty co-eternal.

Manx: Lheid as ta’n Ayr, lheid shen ta’n Mac : as lheid ta’n Spyrryd Noo.
English: Such as the Father is, such is the Son : and such is the Holy Ghost.

Manx: Yn Ayr gyn-chroo, yn Mac gyn-chroo : as y Spyrryd Noo gyn-chroo.
English: The Father uncreate, the Son uncreate : and the Holy Ghost uncreate.

Manx: Yn Ayr er-skyn roshtyn nyn dushtey; yn Mac er-skyn roshtyn nyn dushtey : as y Spyrryd Noo er-skyn nyn dushtey.
English: The Father incomprehensible, the Son incomprehensible : and the Holy Ghost incomprehensible.

Manx: Yn Ayr dy-bragh beayn, yn Mac dy-bragh beayn : as y Spyrryd Noo dy-bragh beayn;
English: The Father eternal, the Son eternal : and the Holy Ghost eternal.

Manx: As foast cha vel ad three dy-bragh beayn : agh unnane dy-bragh beayn.
English: And yet they are not three eternals : but one eternal.

Manx: Myrgeddin myr nagh vel ayn three er-skyn roshtyn nyn dushtey, ny three gyn-chroo : agh unnane gyn-chroo, as unnane er-skyn roshtyn nyn dushtey.
English: As also there are not three incomprehensibles, nor three uncreated : but one uncreated, and one incomprehensible.

Manx: Myr shen myrgeddin ta’n Ayr Ooilley-niartal, yn Mac Ooilley-niartal : as y Spyrryd Noo Ooilley-niartal;
English: So likewise the Father is Almighty, the Son Almighty : and the Holy Ghost Almighty.

Manx: As foast cha nee three Ooilley-niartallyn ad : agh un Ooilley-niartal.
English: And yet they are not three Almighties : but one Almighty.

Manx: Myr shen ta’n Ayr Jee, ta’n Mac Jee : as ta’n Spyrryd Noo Jee;
English: So the Father is God, the Son is God : and the Holy Ghost is God.

Manx: As foast cha vel ad three Jeeghyn : agh un Jee.
English: And yet they are not three Gods : but one God.

Manx: Myr shen myrgeddin ta’n Ayr Chiarn, yn Mac Chiarn : as y Spyrryd Noo Chiarn;
English: So likewise the Father is Lord, the Son Lord : and the Holy Ghost Lord;

Manx: As foast cha nee three Chiarnyn ad : agh un Chiarn.
English: And yet not three Lords : but one Lord.

Manx: Son ’naght myr ta shin kainlt liorish y firrinys Chreestee : dy ghoaill-rish dagh Persoon er-lheh dy ve Jee as Chiarn;
English: For like as we are compelled by the Christian verity : to acknowledge every Person by himself to be God and Lord;

Manx: Myr shen ta shin er nyn lhiettal liorish y Credjue Cadjin [Creestee], dy ghra, Dy vel ayn three Jeeghyn, ny three Chiarnyn.
English: So are we forbidden by the Catholick Religion : to say there be three Gods, or three Lords.

Manx: Cha vel yn Ayr jeant jeh veg : cha-moo er ny chroo, ny er-ny-gheddyn.
English: The Father is made of none : neither created, nor begotten.

Manx: Ta’n Mac jeh’n Ayr ny-lomarcan : cha nee er-ny-yannoo, ny er-ny-chroo, agh er-ny-gheddyn.
English: The Son is of the Father alone : not made, nor created, but begotten.

Manx: Ta’n Spyrryd Noo jeh’n Ayr, as jeh’n Mac : cha-moo er-ny-yannoo, ny er-ny-chroo, ny er-ny-gheddyn, agh cheet magh [vou].
English: The Holy Ghost is of the Father and of the Son : neither made, nor created, nor begotten, but proceeding.

Manx: Myr shen ta ayn un Ayr, cha nee three Ayraghyn; un Vac, cha nee three Mec : un Spyrryd Noo, cha nee three Spyrrydyn Noo.
English: So there is one Father, not three Fathers; one Son, not three Sons : one Holy Ghost, not three Holy Ghosts.

Manx: As ayns y Trinaid shoh cha vel unnane roish, ny lurg fer elley : cha vel unnane na smoo ny na sloo na fer elley;
English: And in this Trinity none is afore, or after other : none is greater, or less than another;

Manx: Agh ta’n slane three Persoonyn co-beayn cooidjagh : as co-chorrym.
English: But the whole three Persons are co-eternal together : and co-equal.

Manx: Myr shen ayns dy-chooilley nhee, myr ve raït roie : ta ooashley dy ve er ny choyrt da’n Unnaneys ayns y Trinaid, as da’n Trinaid ayns Unnaneys.
English: So that in all things, as is aforesaid : the Unity in Trinity, and the Trinity in Unity is to be worshipped.

Manx: Shegin dasyn er-y-fa shen saillish ve er ny hauail : smooinaghtyn myr shoh jeh’n Trinaid.
English: He therefore that will be saved : must thus think of the Trinity.

Manx: Ny sodjey, te ymmyrchagh gys saualtys dy-bragh farraghtyn : dy bee myrgeddin credjue cairagh echey mychione Goaill-foalley nyn Jiarn Yeesey Creest.
English: Furthermore it is necessary to everlasting salvation : that he also believe rightly the Incarnation of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Manx: Son y Credjue cairagh eh, dy jean mayd credjal as goaill-rish : nyn Jiarn Yeesey Creest, Mac Yee, dy ve Jee as dooinney;
English: For the right Faith is that we believe and confess : that our Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of God, is God and Man;

Manx: Jee, jeh Bree yn Ayr, er-ny-gheddyn roish ny seihllyn : as Dooinney, jeh Stoo e Voir, ruggit ayns y theihll;
English: God, of the substance of the Father, begotten before the worlds : and Man, of the Substance of his Mother, born in the world;

Manx: Slane Jee, as slane Dooinney : jeh annym resoonagh, as feill dooinney;
English: Perfect God, and Perfect Man : of a reasonable soul and human flesh subsisting;

Manx: Corrym rish yn Ayr, myr t’eh ny Yee : as ny s’inshley n’yn Ayr myr t’eh ny Ghooinney.
English: Equal to the Father, as touching his Godhead : and inferior to the Father, as touching his Manhood.

Manx: Eshyn, ga t’eh Jee as Dooinney : foast cha vel eh jees, agh un Chreest.
English: Who although he be God and Man : yet he is not two, but one Christ;

Manx: Unnane; cha nee liorish chyndaa yn Jeeys gys feill : agh liorish goaill yn Dooghys-dooinney gys Jee;
English: One, not by conversion of the Godhead into flesh : but by taking of the Manhood into God;

Manx: Unnane ooilley cooidjagh : cha nee liorish coyrt yn derrey ghooghys son y dooghys elley : agh liorish Unnaneys dy Phersoon.
English: One altogether, not by confusion of Substance : but by unity of Person.

Manx: Son myr ta’n annym resoonagh as feill un dooinney : myr shen ta Jee as dooinney un Chreest;
English: For as the reasonable soul and flesh is one man : so God and Man is one Christ;

Manx: Ren surranse son y saualtys ain : hie sheese gys niurin, dirree reesht yn trass laa veih ny merriu :
English: Who suffered for our salvation : descended into hell, rose again the third day from the dead.

Manx: Hie eh seose gys niau, t’eh ny hoie er laue yesh yn Ayr, Jee Ooilley-niartal : veih shen hig eh dy vriwnys ny bio as ny merriu.
English: He ascended into heaven, he sitteth on the right hand of the Father, God Almighty : from whence he shall come to judge the quick and the dead.

Manx: Ec y cheet echeysyn nee dy-chooilley ghooinney girree reesht lesh nyn girp : as nee ad coontey choyrt son nyn obbraghyn hene.
English: At whose coming all men shall rise again with their bodies : and shall give account for their own works.

Manx: As hed adsyn t’er n’yannoo dy-mie, ayns y vea dy-bragh farraghtyn : as adsyn t’er n’yannoo dy-olk, ayns yn aile vees dy-bragh er-mayrn.
English: And they that have done good shall go into life everlasting : and they that have done evil into everlasting fire.

Manx: Shoh yn Credjue Cadjin [Creestee] : mannagh jean dooinney eh y chredjal dy-firrinagh, cha vod eh v’er ny hauail.
English: This is the Catholick Faith : which except a man believe faithfully, he cannot be saved.

Manx: Gloyr dy row gys yn Ayr, as gys y Mac : as gys y Spyrryd Noo;
English: Glory be to the Father, and to the Son : and to the Holy Ghost;

Manx: Myr ve ’sy toshiaght, ta nish, as vees dy-bragh : seihll gyn jerrey. Amen.
English: As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be : world without end. Amen.

Manx: O YEE Ayr niau : jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O GOD the Father of heaven : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: O Yee Ayr niau : jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O God the Father of heaven : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: O Yee yn Mac, Fer-chionnee reesht yn seihll : jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O God the Son, Redeemer of the world : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: O Yee yn Mac, Fer-chionnee reesht yn seihll : jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O God the Son, Redeemer of the world : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: O Yee yn Spyrryd Noo, ta cheet-magh veih’n Ayr as veih’n Mac: jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O God the Holy Ghost, proceeding from the Father and the Son : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: O Yee yn Spyrryd Noo, ta cheet-magh veih’n Ayr as veih’n Mac : jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O God the Holy Ghost, proceeding from the Father and the Son : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: O Hrinaid chasherick, bannit as gloyroil, tree Persoonyn, as un Jee : jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O holy, blessed, and glorious Trinity, three persons, and one God : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: O Hrinaid chasherick, bannit as gloyroil, tree Persoonyn, as un Jee : jean myghin orrin peccee hreih.
English: O holy, blessed, and glorious Trinity, three Persons, and one God : have mercy upon us miserable sinners.

Manx: Ny cooinee, Hiarn, er ny loghtyn ain, ny loghtyn nyn shenn-ayraghyn roin; cha-moo gow kerraghey son ny peccaghyn ain : ymmyrk lhien, Hiarn vie, ymmyrk lesh dty phobble, t’ow er chionnaghey reesht lesh dt’ ooill smoo ooasle, as ny bee corree rooin son dy-bragh.
English: Remember not, Lord, our offences, nor the offences of our forefathers; neither take thou vengeance of our sins : spare us, good Lord, spare thy people, whom thou hast redeemed with thy most precious blood, and be not angry with us for ever.

Manx: Ymmyrk lhien, Hiarn vie.
English: Spare us, good Lord.

Manx: Veih dy-chooilley olk as drogh-haghyrt, veih peccah, veih croutyn as soiagh orrin jeh’n drogh-spyrryd, veih dty chorree, as veih coayl-anmey dy-bragh farraghtyn,
English: From all evil and mischief; from sin, from the crafts and assaults of the devil; from thy wrath, and from everlasting damnation,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Veih dy-chooilley ghellid cree; veih moyrn, gloyr fardalagh, as craueeaght-foalsey; veih troo, myskit, as goanlys, as dy-chooilley vee-yiastyllys,
English: From all blindness of heart; from pride, vain-glory, and hypocrisy; from envy, hatred, and malice, and all uncharitableness,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Veih maarderys, as dy-chooilley pheccah baaish elley; as veih dy-chooilley volteyraght jeh’n theihll, yn eill as drogh-spyrryd,
English: From fornication, and all other deadly sin; and from all the deceits of the world, the flesh, and the devil,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Veih tendeil as dorrin; veih cramp, paitt, as gortey; veih caggey as dunverys, as veih baase doaltattym,
English: From lightning and tempest; from plague, pestilence, and famine; from battle and murder, and from sudden death,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Veih dy-chooilley irree-magh, as drogh choyrle noi ny pooaraghyn syrjey, gy-follit ny gy-foshlit; veih dy-chooilley ynsagh foalsey, shaghrynys ayns credjue, as scarrey veih dt’ Agglish; veih creoghys cree, as soiaghey beg jeh dty Ghoo’s as dt’ Annaghyn,
English: From all sedition, privy conspiracy, and rebellion; from all false doctrine, heresy, and schism; from hardness of heart, and contempt of thy Word and Commandment,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Liorish folliaght dty Ghoaill-foalley casherick; liorish dty Heet casherick er y theihll, as dty Yiarey-chymmylt, liorish dty Vashtey, dty Hrostey, as dty Violagh,
English: By the mystery of thy holy Incarnation; by thy holy Nativity and Circumcision; by thy Baptism, Fasting, and Temptation,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Liorish dty Annooinid baaish, as dt’ Ollish foalley; liorish dty Chrosh as dty Hurranse; liorish dty Vaase deyr as dt’ Oanluckey; liorish dt’ Irree-seose-reesht gloyroil as Goll-seose gys niau; as liorish cheet-neose y Spyrryd Noo,
English: By thine Agony and bloody Sweat; by thy Cross and Passion; by thy precious Death and Burial; by thy glorious Resurrection and Ascension; and by the coming of the Holy Ghost,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Ayns dy-chooilley earish jeh nyn seaghyn; ayns dy-chooilley earish jeh nyn maynrys; ayns oor y vaaish, as ayns laa ny briwnys,
English: In all time of our tribulation; in all time of our wealth; in the hour of death, and in the day of judgement,

Manx: Hiarn vie, livrey shin.
English: Good Lord, deliver us.

Manx: Ta shinyn peccee guee ort dy chlashtyn rooin, O Hiarn Yee; as dy gooidsave lhiat dy reill as dy ghurneil dty Agglish casherick trooid magh ooilley’n seihll ayns y raad cair;
English: We sinners do beseech thee to hear us, O Lord God; and that it may please thee to rule and govern thy holy Church universal in the right way;

Manx: Ta shin guee ort dy chlashtyn rooin, Hiarn vie.
English: We beseech thee to hear us, good Lord.

Manx: Dy gooidsave lhiat dy reaylley as dy niartaghey ayns ammys firrinagh jeed’s, ayns cairys as casherickys bea, dty harvaant GEORGE, nyn Ree as nyn Giannoort smoo graysoil;
English: That it may please thee to keep and strengthen in the true worshipping of thee, in righteousness and holiness of life, thy Servant GEORGE, our most gracious King and Governor;

Manx: Ta shin guee ort dy chlashtyn rooin, Hiarn vie.
English: We beseech thee to hear us, good Lord.

Manx: Dy gooidsave lhiat dy reill e chree ayns dty chredjue, dt’ aggle, as dty ghraih; as dy vod eh dy-bragh e varrant y choyrt ort, as dy-kinjagh shirrey dt’ onnor as dty ghloyr;
English: That it may please thee to rule his heart in thy faith, fear, and love, and that he may evermore have affiance in thee, and ever seek thy honour and glory;

Manx: Ta shin guee ort dy chlashtyn rooin, Hiarn vie.
English: We beseech thee to hear us, good Lord.

Manx: Dy gooidsave lhiat dy ve fendeilagh as fer-coadee da, coyrt da yn varriaght harrish ooilley e noidyn;
English: That it may please thee to be his defender and keeper, giving him the victory over all his enemies;

Manx: Ta shin guee ort dy chlashtyn rooin, Hiarn vie.
English: We beseech thee to hear us, good Lord.

Manx: Dy gooidsave lhiat dy vannaghey as dy choadey yn Ven-reïn smoo graysoil ain Charlotte, yn Ard-ooashley Reeoil oc George Prince jeh Wales, yn Princess treoghe jeh Wales, as ooilley’n Sluight Reeoil;
English: That it may please thee to bless and preserve our gracious Queen Charlotte, their Royal Highnesses George Prince of Wales, the Princess Dowager of Wales, and all the Royal Family;

Manx: Ta shin guee ort dy chlashtyn rooin, Hiarn vie.
English: We beseech thee to hear us, good Lord.

Manx: Dy gooidsave lhiat dy hoilshaghey dy-chooilley Aspick, Saggyrt, as Shirveishagh, lesh tushtey as toiggal firrinagh jeh dty Ghoo; dy vod ad chammah liorish nyn breacheil as nyn mea, soiaghey eh magh, as soilshaghey eh myrgeddin;
English: That it may please thee to illuminate all Bishops, Priests, and Deacons, with true knowledge and understanding of thy Word; and that both by their preaching and living they may set it forth and shew it accordingly;

Manx: Ta shin guee ort dy chlashtyn rooin, Hiarn vie.
English: We beseech thee to hear us, good Lord.

Manx: Dy gooidsave lhiat dy choamrey Chiarnyn y Choonceil, as ooilley’n Ooashley [as maroosyn yn Chiarn, yn Lady, as Fir-reill yn Ellan shoh[1]], lesh grayse, creenaght, as tushtey;
